item.title: Study Confirms That Fox News Makes You Stupid
item.dc:creator: @yakman yakman
item.description:
@yakman wrote:

[quote=“Moparisthebest, post:32, topic:373549”][quote author=yakman link=topic=469558.msg3440520#msg3440520 date=1293059651]

He DID come out and satisfy them though, and people still weren’t happy. The same people that think we didn’t land on the moon, I suspect.
[/quote]More like the same people that think the moon should be property of US.

Well, we are the only country with flags there… ;D

That’s not correct. Many nations have sent probes and crafts to the moon which have their flags painted on them. The Soviet Union, India, the European Union and Japan all have flags up there.

Furthermore, the Apollo astronauts actually took the flags of many nations with them. They wrapped up some moon rocks in them and gave them to the heads of the respective nations. The UK flag they did it with is now at 10 Downing Street.

The astronauts praised all the scientists that made their journey possible, they even did the demonstration where they drop a hammer and feather at the same time, in honour of Galileo who was Italian. The moon landings were about discovery, knowledge and science. Not petty nationalism.

So I was right, we are the only country with actual flags there (not painted on ones) that were set by american astronauts. Anyway, I know the US doesn’t ‘own’ the moon, it was just a joke. :)[/quote]

Read full topic
item.source: Study Confirms That Fox News Makes You Stupid

item.title: Study Confirms That Fox News Makes You Stupid
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

[quote=“yakman, post:25, topic:373549”][quote author=Moparisthebest link=topic=469558.msg3437392#msg3437392 date=1292861662]

He DID come out and satisfy them though, and people still weren’t happy. The same people that think we didn’t land on the moon, I suspect.
[/quote]More like the same people that think the moon should be property of US.

Well, we are the only country with flags there… ;D

That’s not correct. Many nations have sent probes and crafts to the moon which have their flags painted on them. The Soviet Union, India, the European Union and Japan all have flags up there.

Furthermore, the Apollo astronauts actually took the flags of many nations with them. They wrapped up some moon rocks in them and gave them to the heads of the respective nations. The UK flag they did it with is now at 10 Downing Street.

The astronauts praised all the scientists that made their journey possible, they even did the demonstration where they drop a hammer and feather at the same time, in honour of Galileo who was Italian. The moon landings were about discovery, knowledge and science. Not petty nationalism.[/quote]

So I was right, we are the only country with actual flags there (not painted on ones) that were set by american astronauts. Anyway, I know the US doesn’t ‘own’ the moon, it was just a joke.

Read full topic
item.source: Study Confirms That Fox News Makes You Stupid

item.title: Study Confirms That Fox News Makes You Stupid
item.dc:creator: @Frell Frell
item.description:
@Frell wrote:

Almost everyone you see watches the news. It doesn’t matter what it is, Fox, CNN, BBC, MSNBC etc. Along with that, these people that were interviewed might only watch fox just to see the actual news reports that don’t have anything to do with politics. Now if you watch CNN and Fox ALL the time you’re going to be influenced by after-news programs.

You either watch/listen/read some sort of news no matter what it is.

Read full topic
item.source: Study Confirms That Fox News Makes You Stupid

item.title: Study Confirms That Fox News Makes You Stupid
item.dc:creator: @The_Un-Named The Un-Named
item.description:
@The_Un-Named wrote:

mwiebelhaus:

Wow I wish I had 30 minutes to take your statment like you did mine, bisect it, and write paragraphs for each statement but sadly I don’t really give a shit.

Was more like 20 minutes including the time it took to read and google everything but eh, that was me done for the day. (and if it wasn’t obvious enough, I have a lot of free time)

mwiebelhaus:

The only thing not bashing fox news was this statement

I can agree they do appear to be heavily biased but at first glance with good reason, the study showed that in cases people who watched more of fox news than/and less of other news stations that they appeared to be more misinformed, similar story with MSNBC PBS and the other stations(sorry I forgot their names :o) but to a lesser extent.

Read full topic

item.title: Study Confirms That Fox News Makes You Stupid
item.dc:creator: @yakman yakman
item.description:
@yakman wrote:

[quote=“Moparisthebest, post:20, topic:373549”][quote author=Speljohan link=topic=469558.msg3437286#msg3437286 date=1292850503]

He DID come out and satisfy them though, and people still weren’t happy. The same people that think we didn’t land on the moon, I suspect.
[/quote]More like the same people that think the moon should be property of US.

Well, we are the only country with flags there… ;D[/quote]

That’s not correct. Many nations have sent probes and crafts to the moon which have their flags painted on them. The Soviet Union, India, the European Union and Japan all have flags up there.

Furthermore, the Apollo astronauts actually took the flags of many nations with them. They wrapped up some moon rocks in them and gave them to the heads of the respective nations. The UK flag they did it with is now at 10 Downing Street.

The astronauts praised all the scientists that made their journey possible, they even did the demonstration where they drop a hammer and feather at the same time, in honour of Galileo who was Italian. The moon landings were about discovery, knowledge and science. Not petty nationalism.

item.dc:creator: @Pwnd Pwnd
item.description:
@Pwnd wrote:

Mass media isn’t generally “dishonest” (not saying it totally isn’t, but I’d rather call it biased), they just don’t report on the things they should be reporting on IE news.

item.title: Study Confirms That Fox News Makes You Stupid
item.dc:creator: @R.I.P_RSC R.I.P RSC
item.description:
@R.I.P_RSC wrote:

You don’t need huge surveys, as long as your sample group is representative of the whole population. Besides, this survey only proves that there might be correlation between Fox-viewers and idiots.

Read full topic
item.source: Study Confirms That Fox News Makes You Stupid

item.title: Study Confirms That Fox News Makes You Stupid
item.dc:creator: @mwiebelhaus mwiebelhaus
item.description:
@mwiebelhaus wrote:

Wow I wish I had 30 minutes to take your statment like you did mine, bisect it, and write paragraphs for each statement but sadly I don’t really give a shit.

Wordpublicopinion is not really biasest they just posted a shitty survey
AlterVista is completely biasest

The only thing not bashing fox news was this statement

By the way, the rest of the media was not blameless. CNN and the broadcast network news operations fared only slightly better in many cases. Even MSNBC, which had the best record of accurately informing viewers, has a ways to go before it can brag about it.
But goes nowhere of saying that CNN, or MSNBC are blatanyly dishonest (even though they "fared only slightly better")

Sample size is everything and im assuming they took it from around the area where the college is. I don’t trust any surveys unless the same size in near the 100,000’s. You cant find out how many people answered the survey dishonestly.

Maybe they should ask questions such as:
Did you answer this survey honestly?
Are you sure of where the information came from?

Im sorry, I’d try and spend more time arguing but I don’t have enough motivation to argue with someone on the internet for an extended period of time. When I know they will never admit they are wrong even if they are, and I will never admit I am wrong even if I am.

Read full topic
item.source: Study Confirms That Fox News Makes You Stupid

item.title: Study Confirms That Fox News Makes You Stupid
item.dc:creator: @The_Un-Named The Un-Named
item.description:
@The_Un-Named wrote:

mwiebelhaus:

WOW THEY INTERVIEWED 848 PEOPLE

That’s still quite a large sample size.

mwiebelhaus:

In perspective they interviewed 0.0002% of the population

If you’re going to bash ‘liberal news outlets’ for being intellectually dishonest then don’t do the same thing, the percentage of USA’s population is irrelevant as it was voters who were questioned(about 0.001% but that is also largely irrelevant), not the general public.

mwiebelhaus:

I love how the liberal american news media loves to jump all over this ridiculious shit fuck survey of practically less than a high school full of people and label it as “survey shows fox news makes people stupider”.

and I love how you’re dismissing the actual results and joining the bandwagon of bashing everything with disinformation,

mwiebelhaus:

Then I love how another liberal news outlet takes the information and removes more information to make it seem like more legit informaiton (removing number of people surveyed and the fact that other news networks such as CNBC had the same effects, etc).

I mean sure the link OP posted didn’t mention the amount of people surveyed(but it’s not like such information is hard to find, they link to the fucking source for christ sakes) but what was that? They didn’t mention other news outlets?

By the way, the rest of the media was not blameless. CNN and the broadcast network news operations fared only slightly better in many cases. Even MSNBC, which had the best record of accurately informing viewers, has a ways to go before it can brag about it.

Sure looks like those dirty liberal news outlets are taking every opportunity at bashing fox news and fox news alone!

[quote=“mwiebelhaus, post:8, topic:373549”]Bottom-line people just guessed on the survey because they didnt listen closely enough to the news program that was infact telling the truthful information and most of those questions can go ethie way depending on what research you are looking at.

tl;tr: idiots post shit on forums because they are idiots[/quote]

Oh christ grow up, you took this opportunity to ignore the survey and bash those liberal news outlets for not including all relevant information(when in fact the only thing the link OP posted was missing was the number of people questioned) and you’re best defense against the survey is that the people questioned didn’t REALLY listen to the news? I can’t decide what’s more disturbing, what you just said or the figures in the poll suggesting 9 out of 10 people questioned think that they encountered misleading information, with 56% thinking that misleading information occurred frequently and 54% thinking it was more frequent than previous elections. (but see below)

mwiebelhaus:

especailly when there is so many external factors that aren’t taken into account, such as other sources of information that could have been the cause of many of the responses in this specific survey.

But they were, what you see is fox news bashing, what I see is the poll suggests the biggest number of reports of misinformation was from those who watched less news than others which seems completely valid and expected, however in some cases those who watched fox news were misinformed on various topics and to a lesser extent the same thing with those who watched msnbc npr pbs etc.

Read full topic

item.title: Study Confirms That Fox News Makes You Stupid
item.dc:creator: @Frell Frell
item.description:
@Frell wrote:

[quote=“R.I.P RSC, post:14, topic:373549”][quote author=Frell link=topic=469558.msg3436199#msg3436199 date=1292781628]

he hasn’t shown any proof and thats what the hype is about

IN FOX NEWS, BIRTH CERTIFICATES ARE NOT PROOF ENUF

Even CNN said the president has provided a birth certificate copy
[/quote]

What more do you want? You’re not saying that one or all of your three-letter party-pooping agencies that are capable of inciting civil wars all around the world, are unable to find out if your president was born in the USA. Are you?[/quote]
I know he was born here, dont get me wrong. Im telling you why people think he wasn’t.

Read full topic
item.source: Study Confirms That Fox News Makes You Stupid

item.title: Study Confirms That Fox News Makes You Stupid
item.dc:creator: @mwiebelhaus mwiebelhaus
item.description:
@mwiebelhaus wrote:

[quote=“R.I.P RSC, post:14, topic:373549”][quote author=Frell link=topic=469558.msg3436199#msg3436199 date=1292781628]

he hasn’t shown any proof and thats what the hype is about

IN FOX NEWS, BIRTH CERTIFICATES ARE NOT PROOF ENUF

Even CNN said the president has provided a birth certificate copy
[/quote]

What more do you want? You’re not saying that one or all of your three-letter party-pooping agencies that are capable of inciting civil wars all around the world, are unable to find out if your president was born in the USA. Are you?[/quote]

Seeing that the heads of these agencies were all appointed by the president. The truth is nobody will ever know forsure, it is so easy to counterfeit documents so you can either trust him when he says that he was born here, or you can always have the doubt in your mind that he might not have been.
